intro: Anchusa incana, commonly known as hoary blueweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe, North Africa, and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, gray-green foliage and spikes of blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in full sun. Anchusa incana is often found in disturbed areas, along roadsides, and in grasslands. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional herbal medicine.
